content.question: What evidence supplied by Crosby most directly supports the claim that Old World forage grasses were particularly important to livestock used by European colonists?

choices.label: Old World animals used as livestock were able to consume the local grasses in the Americas, Australia, and New Zealand.
Old World forage grasses were not imported deliberately by European settlers in the New World.
Old World forage grasses constituted only a tiny percentage of the natural variety of grasses.
Old World forage grasses were tolerant of close cropping and being constantly trod upon by animals.

content.answer: Old World forage grasses were tolerant of close cropping and being constantly trod upon by animals.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
